item.title: Pallets and commercial waste blocking pedestrian pavement, 11th January
item.description:
Multiple businesses along this road are repeatedly leaving wooden pallets and commercial waste on the public pavement, causing obstruction to pedestrians. As shown in the attached photos, pallets are being stored directly on the pedestrian walkway against the building frontage. This forces pedestrians to step into the road, creating a safety risk—particularly at night and for vulnerable users such as wheelchair users, parents with prams, and the elderly. This is not an isolated incident. The issue appears ongoing and is caused by businesses using the public footway as free storage rather than arranging proper collection or on-site storage. This area has already suffered from repeated misuse by commercial operators, and residents should not have to tolerate pavements being treated as private loading bays. I am requesting enforcement action and that the responsible businesses be instructed to remove the pallets immediately and stop using the pavement for storage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Commercial Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why is Ruskin avenue neglected??, 10th January
item.description:
Ruskin avenue is neglected!! I have never seen a road sweeper in the years that I have lived here but regularly I see them daily on the main road and other side streets. My property is near an alleyway with flats above the commercial units below. Thy don’t have use of any bins that I know of and use mine and my neighbours bins so when we go to take waste out the bins are already full. The area outside our door has become a dumping ground with regular missed re cycle collections, rats attacking bags on floor as no space in bins and people dumping old items like suitcases etc. we need a road sweeper and some control of fly ripping by people behind the shops to have their own bins so they so they don’t discard their rubbish outside our properties

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruskin Avenue, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
